channel.title: reflection on saucesaft
channel.description: Recent content in reflection on saucesaft

item.title: Interface
item.description: What’s the purpose of a calculator? Calculate. What’s the pupose of some digital callipers? Measure. Just some vague examples of old (really old) computing. People like Ada Loveace set the standards for modern computing. During World War 2, the germans developed the Engima Machine, rasing the bar of encryption. British geniuses reunited and developed an algorithm to break the cypher, if done manually would take constant days of work, bad thing that the Germans changed the hash every 12 hours.

item.title: Tacos
item.description: No me gusta comer tacos, son ineficientes y aburridos.

item.title: Cheaper to write software
item.description: It is definetly easier and cheaper to add some if statements to a program than physical functionality. the firmware of my soldering iron just crashed — whitequark (@whitequark) January 17, 2020 Recently i’ve had to develop some software that needed to interface an Arduino, well it wasn’t originally like that. It was supposed to have some lcds and 8-segment displays which the arduino could drive and show temperature values via sensors.
